com.defano.jmonet.transform.image

Class ColorReductionTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.transform.image.ColorReductionTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageTransform, StaticImageTransform

    public class ColorReductionTransform
extends Object
implements StaticImageTransform
    Converts the color space of an image to a reduced palette containing no more than a specified number of colors.

    Note that this transform merely adjusts the look of the image and does not affect the image storage in any way (all images are always stored in 24-bit "true color" irrespective of whether they have been reduced via this method). Thus, reducing colors will not reduce memory usage or affect how the image is exported or saved.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorReductionTransform(Ditherer ditherer, int colorDepth)
      Constructs a color reduction transform.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorReductionTransform

        public ColorReductionTransform(Ditherer ditherer,
                               int colorDepth)
        Constructs a color reduction transform.
        Parameters:
        colorDepth - The maximum number of unique colors that should appear in the resultant selection image; zero produces a black and white (monochrome) image. Note that color depth should be cubic; if the cubed root of colorDepth is not an integer, the the floor of the cubed root will be assumed.
        ditherer - The dithering algorithm to use, for example, FloydSteinbergDitherer.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public BufferedImage apply(BufferedImage source)
        Applies a transform operation to the given image, producing a new, transformed image of the same dimensions as the source image. This method does not destroy or otherwise mutate the source image.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface ImageTransform
        Specified by:
        apply in interface StaticImageTransform
        Parameters:
        source - The source image to which the transform should be applied.
        Returns:
        A new, transformed image.
